Package gui

Class StateGenerating

java.lang.Object
generation.DefaultOrder
gui.StateGenerating
All Implemented Interfaces:
Order, State
public class StateGenerating extends DefaultOrder implements State
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the second stage where the user sees a progress bar while a maze is generated by the factory. This class is part of a state pattern for the Controller class. It is a ConcreteState. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener in Control and then handed over with a call to the handleUserInput method. Responsibilities: Show the generating screen and the progress during generation, Accept input to interrupt and cancel the maze generation and return to title screen, Generate a maze with the maze factory. This code contains refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    StateGenerating()
    Constructor uses default settings such that a Depth-First-Search algorithm is used as the generation method a maze of smallest possible size.

      public StateGenerating()

  • Method Details

    • setRobot

      public void setRobot​(String robot)

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName​(String filename)
      Sets the filename. Calling with null does not hurt but is pointless as maze will be then generated randomly, which is the default behavior anyway. The filename must be set before start is called or it will have no effect for this round of the game.
      Parameters:
      filename - provides the name of a file to load a previously generated and stored maze from. Can be null.

    • start

      public void start​(Control controller, MazePanel panel)
      Start the maze generation.
      Specified by:
      start in interface State
      Parameters:
      controller - needed to be able to switch states, not null
      panel - is the UI entity to produce the generating screen on

    • handleUserInput

      public boolean handleUserInput​(Constants.UserInput userInput, int value)
      The method provides an appropriate response to user keyboard input. The control calls this method to communicate input and delegate its handling. Method requires start to be called before.
      Specified by:
      handleUserInput in interface State
      Parameters:
      userInput - provides the user request, here only return to title screen is supported
      value - is not used in this state, exists only for consistency across State classes
      Returns:
      true if handled, false if input comes before start was called

    • deliver

      public void deliver​(Maze mazeConfig)
      The deliver method is the call back method for the background thread operated in the maze factory to deliver the ordered product, here the generated maze in its container, the MazeConfiguration object.
      Specified by:
      deliver in interface Order
      Overrides:
      deliver in class DefaultOrder
      Parameters:
      mazeConfig - the maze generated by the MazeFactory

    • switchFromGeneratingToPlaying

      public void switchFromGeneratingToPlaying​(Maze maze)
      Switches the controller to the playing screen. This is where the user or a robot can navigate through the maze and play the game.
      Parameters:
      maze - contains a maze to play

    • switchToTitle

      public void switchToTitle()
      Switches the controller to the initial screen.

    • updateProgress

      public void updateProgress​(int percentage)
      Allows external increase to percentage in generating mode. Internal value is only updated if it exceeds the last value and is less or equal 100
      Specified by:
      updateProgress in interface Order
      Overrides:
      updateProgress in class DefaultOrder
      Parameters:
      percentage - gives the new percentage on a range [0,100]
